turns.content: What is the length of the Great Wall of China, and how long did it take to build?

The length of the Great Wall of China is approximately 13,170 miles (21,196 km). It took over 2000 years to build, with the first sections being built by the Qin Dynasty in the 7th century BC, and the last sections being built during the Ming Dynasty in the 17th century AD.
Wow, that's a long time to build a wall! Do you know how many workers were involved in its construction throughout history?

It is estimated that millions of workers were involved in the construction of the Great Wall of China throughout history, but the exact number is unknown. Some historians believe that over one million workers may have died during the building of the wall due to harsh working conditions, such as extreme cold, heat, and dangerous terrain.
What a waste of human life and resources, all for a wall. I wonder if the benefits it provided were worth it in the end.

I do not have personal opinions or beliefs. however, historians have debated the effectiveness and benefit of the great wall of china throughout history. while it acted as a physical barrier against invaders, it was not impenetrable, and some sections of the wall were breached or avoided by invaders. the cost of building and maintaining the wall may have also put a heavy burden on the country's resources and the lives of its citizens. despite this, the great wall of china has become an iconic symbol of chinese history and culture, and remains a popular attraction for tourists.
